instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .
definitions.PP1V8_S3: What is PP1V8_S3? The PP1V8_S3 signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides a voltage of 1.8 volts during the S3 power state. The S3 state, often referred to as "suspend to RAM," is a low-power mode where the computer saves the session's state to RAM, allowing for quicker wake-up times compared to a full shutdown..
definitions.PPVCCSA_S0_CPU: What is PPVCCSA_S0_CPU? Main power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. This is NOT shorted to ground if it has a low resistance â€“ this is a common mistake people make. A chip that requires high power at a low voltage like a CPU or GPU will have a low measured resistance to ground..
definitions.PP3V0_G3H: What is PP3V0_G3H? PP3V0_G3H is a 3.0v power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state..
definitions.PPVCCIO_S0_CPU: What is PPVCCIO_S0_CPU? PPVCCIO_S0_CPU is a power rail responsible for powering the part of the CPU responsible for communicating with other portions of the machine prior to PPVCORE_S0_CPU being present and must be present before vcore, PPVCCIO_S0_CPU is present when the machine is in an on, RUNNING state. .
definitions.PP1V8_S4: What is PP1V8_S4? PP1V8_S4 is a 1.8v power rail when the machine is in an S4, suspend to disk state. .
definitions.PP1V8_SUS: What is PP1V8_SUS? PP1V8_SUS is a 1.8v power rail active in a suspend state..

threads.title: Macbook 820-000239 no power
threads.message:
Hello friends I have this computer that when connecting the usb c the fans rotate at full speed, but it does not turn on, check these voltages:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 13.01

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_CPU13</SIGNAL>.01

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_OTH5V</SIGNAL> 13.01

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_OTH3V3</SIGNAL> 13.01

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S4_HS_TPAD</SIGNAL> 13.01

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 20.23

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.4

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SMC_ISNS</SIGNAL> 3.4

<SIGNAL>PP3V0_G3H</SIGNAL>

<SIGNAL>PP1V0_SUS</SIGNAL> 1.0

<SIGNAL>PP1V0_SUSSW</SIGNAL>

<SIGNAL>PP1V0_S3</SIGNAL>

<SIGNAL>PP1V0_S0SW</SIGNAL> 0.996

<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 1.0

<SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 1.0

<SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 0 / 3.1 ohms

<SIGNAL>PPVCCIO_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 0.954

PPVCCPRIMCORE_SUS_PCH 1v

<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> 1.2v

<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3_CPUDDR</SIGNAL> 1.2

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S4</SIGNAL> 1.8

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S3</SIGNAL> 1.8

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S3_MEM</SIGNAL> 1.8

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0</SIGNAL> 1.8

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 5.1

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> 5.1

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_T139</SIGNAL> 5.1

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4SW</SIGNAL> 0

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4SW_ISNS</SIGNAL> 0

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 5.1

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_KBD</SIGNAL> 5.1

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.3

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> 3.3

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> 3.3

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_2V7_NAND_VCC</SIGNAL> 0.. 

<SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> line has 0v verify in diode mode and resistance with reference to ground
Diode: 0.007
Cpu is dead? 
Resistance: 3.0 ohm

threads.title: Macbook 820-000239 no power
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4SW</SIGNAL> 0"
Did you check for short?

No idea about other voltages where you posted names, without values!

Post <CHIP>U8213</CHIP> voltages.

threads.title: Macbook 820-000239 no power
threads.message:
<CHIP>U8213</CHIP> is not factory installed

Check voltage on the pads:
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> 5.1v
<SIGNAL>SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>: 3.3v
<SIGNAL>P5V_S4SW_SNS_FET_RAMP</SIGNAL>: It ranges from 1v to 600mv
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4SW</SIGNAL>: now It ranges from 1v to 600mv

threads.title: Macbook 820-000239 no power
threads.message:
"<CHIP>U8213</CHIP> is not factory installed"
Then <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4SW</SIGNAL> is not required.

Really no need to measure PPBUS in 5 points!

VCCGT only appears under high graphics load; no short there.

"<SIGNAL>PP3V3_2V7_NAND_VCC</SIGNAL> 0"
This is a problem.
Check diode mode to ground first.
If no short, post <CHIP>U9400</CHIP> voltages; pins 19, 20, 15.

threads.title: Macbook 820-000239 no power
threads.message: The metal plate of J9600 is in place?
